title: If I were to write a screenplay, how would I get it considered for a movie? - Quora

response.answer_text: Your screenplay would get considered for a movie if you sent it to an agent, s/he read it and was impressed with your script, s/he contacted you and was also impressed with you, s/he and you pitched the script to a producer or studio development executives, and the pitch meeting went well.

Buy shopping it to producers or agents. But that generally doesn’t work, because producers generally are already inundated, and if you don’t have an agent, it may take some time to generate interest, which WILL take more than one screenplay. The film industry is generally very vetted in processes, and a lot about who you know. You’ll want to first worry about getting an agent, which will take a lot of very solid writing samples and the ability to pitch your ideas.
